title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
description: “I liked just about everything about your movie. But what I liked best was your discovery of self. Kermit, you are no longer a frog with an identity crisis. You’ve found the right persona, old boy, and it will see you through a dozen more movies.” – Roger Ebert

title: The Sparks Brothers (New 35mm Print)
description: Marc Edward Heuck writes about Sparks and film soundtracks on the New Bev blog.

title: The Song Remains the Same
description: A mesmerizing, blacklight poster peek into the music & mind of Led Zeppelin! Featuring mythic performances from the band’s creative heyday at their famed 1973 concerts at New York’s Madison Square Garden, interspersing blistering renditions of their classic catalogue with psychedelic fantasy, hallucination, and behind-the-scenes glimpses of Jimmy Page, Robert Plant, John Paul Jones, and the late, great John Bonham.

title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
description: “I liked just about everything about your movie. But what I liked best was your discovery of self. Kermit, you are no longer a frog with an identity crisis. You’ve found the right persona, old boy, and it will see you through a dozen more movies.” – Roger Ebert

title: The Sparks Brothers (New 35mm Print)
description: Marc Edward Heuck writes about Sparks and film soundtracks on the New Bev blog.

title: The Final Girls (New 35mm Print)
description: A thrilling mix of killer comedy & heartfelt emotion meets a machete-wielding, summer camp terrorizing madman in this love letter to ‘80s horror. When a young woman grieving the loss of her scream queen mother attends a repertory screening of mom’s most famous starring role, she and her friends get sucked directly into the mayhem on screen. Now they’ll have to use their wits, and the bonds of reunited family, if they’re to escape a Camp Bloodbath. Taissa Farmiga & Malin Akerman headline an excellent ensemble cast, while the screenplay by M.A. Fortin & Joshua John Miller deftly mixes the laughs and scares.

title: Teen Witch
description: Being a teen girl is hard. You’ve got to deal with boys, boobs, bratty brothers and Brad, the hunky football star at school who doesn’t even know you’re alive. Uggghhh! But when you find out on your 16th birthday that you’re descended from Salem witches, life is, like, totally going to get complicated. But new powers bring new responsibilities and when you’re suddenly the most popular gal in town, sometimes the hardest thing to do is just be true to yourself. Teen Witch is a sweet-natured coming-of-age fairy tale and a non-stop fun machine dealing with the tough topics of today (rap battles, magical ability), a hilarious cotton candy comedy packed with teased-out neon fashion, a you’ll-never-get-it-out-of-your-head soundtrack of original songs (seriously, you’re gonna have to dig deep to Top That) and a cast with supernatural appeal: the duo of Robyn Lively and Dan Gauthier, Near Dark’s Joshua John Miller, and Poltergeist’s Zelda Rubinstein just to get started. So grab your wand and head to the New Bev to fall under the Teen Witch spell all over again!

title: In the Mood for Love (New 35mm Print)
description: In early ’60s Hong Kong, two neighbors (Tony Leung Chiu Wai and Maggie Cheung Man Yuk) whose spouses share a secret slowly form an intimate bond. A melancholy and nuanced tale of lovelorn romance, longing, and regret, Wong Kar Wai’s lushly poetic masterpiece of mood and color features unforgettably gorgeous cinematography by Christopher Doyle and Mark Lee Ping Bing, stunning production design, and a smoldering soundtrack.

title: In the Mood for Love (New 35mm Print)
description: In early ’60s Hong Kong, two neighbors (Tony Leung Chiu Wai and Maggie Cheung Man Yuk) whose spouses share a secret slowly form an intimate bond. A melancholy and nuanced tale of lovelorn romance, longing, and regret, Wong Kar Wai’s lushly poetic masterpiece of mood and color features unforgettably gorgeous cinematography by Christopher Doyle and Mark Lee Ping Bing, stunning production design, and a smoldering soundtrack.

title: The Power of the Dog (New 35mm Print)
description: “Campion handles the story with puzzle-box precision, but the power of this movie goes beyond its clockwork plotting and startling, deeply satisfying denouement.” – Justin Chang, Los Angeles Times

title: The Crow
description: People once believed that when someone dies, a crow carries their soul to the land of the dead. But sometimes, just sometimes, the crow can bring that soul back to put the wrong things right. The big screen goth fantasy update of James O’Barr’s comic follows a murdered musician resurrected to avenge his death and the murder of his fiancé. Featuring a soulful performance by the late Brandon Lee, stellar, rain-slicked cinematography by Dariusz Wolski, and a propulsive, chart-topping soundtrack featuring songs by The Cure, The Jesus and Mary Chain, Rage Against the Machine, Nine Inch Nails, Stone Temple Pilots, and more.

title: The Power of the Dog (New 35mm Print)
description: “Campion handles the story with puzzle-box precision, but the power of this movie goes beyond its clockwork plotting and startling, deeply satisfying denouement.” – Justin Chang, Los Angeles Times

title: Death Proof
description: “The climactic extended car chase is a bona fide old-school tour de force.” – Ben Walters, Time Out

title: Muppet Treasure Island
description: The Muppets hit the high seas in a hilariously high-spirited take on the classic Robert Louis Stevenson tale. When a young orphan inherits a long-lost treasure map, he sets sail for a fun-filled, music-packed adventure with Kermit the Frog & friends. But a greedy pirate (Tim Curry) has his eyes on the loot, too.

title: Nightmare Alley: Vision in Darkness and Light
description: When charismatic but down-on-his-luck Stanton Carlisle (Bradley Cooper) endears himself to clairvoyant Zeena (Toni Collette) and her has-been mentalist husband Pete (David Strathairn) at a traveling carnival, he crafts a golden ticket to success, using this newly acquired knowledge to grift the wealthy elite of 1940s New York society. With the virtuous Molly (Rooney Mara) loyally by his side, Stanton plots to con a dangerous tycoon (Richard Jenkins) with the aid of a mysterious psychiatrist (Cate Blanchett) who might be his most formidable opponent yet. (Searchlight Pictures)

title: Monterey Pop (4-Track Mag Print)
description: Rare 4-Track Mag Print! The first great & groovy rock festival film! D.A. Pennebaker’s legendary concert documentary showcases the historic, pre-Woodstock 1967 Monterey International Pop Festival including incendiary performances by Janis Joplin, The Who, Jefferson Airplane, Mamas and Papas, Otis Redding, Country Joe and the Fish, Jimi Hendrix, The Animals, Ravi Shankar, Simon and Garfunkel, Canned Heat and Hugh Masekela!

title: Muppet Treasure Island
description: The Muppets hit the high seas in a hilariously high-spirited take on the classic Robert Louis Stevenson tale. When a young orphan inherits a long-lost treasure map, he sets sail for a fun-filled, music-packed adventure with Kermit the Frog & friends. But a greedy pirate (Tim Curry) has his eyes on the loot, too.

title: Nightmare Alley: Vision in Darkness and Light
description: When charismatic but down-on-his-luck Stanton Carlisle (Bradley Cooper) endears himself to clairvoyant Zeena (Toni Collette) and her has-been mentalist husband Pete (David Strathairn) at a traveling carnival, he crafts a golden ticket to success, using this newly acquired knowledge to grift the wealthy elite of 1940s New York society. With the virtuous Molly (Rooney Mara) loyally by his side, Stanton plots to con a dangerous tycoon (Richard Jenkins) with the aid of a mysterious psychiatrist (Cate Blanchett) who might be his most formidable opponent yet. (Searchlight Pictures)

title: New York Ninja (New 35mm Print)
description: A city plagued by crime turns to a new kind of hero! A mild-mannered working man will become a sword wielding ninja vigilante after the brutal murder of his pregnant wife. And, yes, sometimes he even wears roller skates when ridding the streets of muggers, pickpockets, rapists, and kidnappers. But his quest for justice makes him the target of every criminal in the city, including a mysterious villain known only as the Plutonium Killer. Originally directed by and starring martial arts actor John Liu (The Secret Rivals, Invincible Armor) in his only American production, New York Ninja was filmed entirely on 35mm in 1984, but the project was abandoned during production resulting in all original sound materials being lost over time. 35 years later, Vinegar Syndrome acquired the original unedited camera negative and painstakingly constructed and completed the film, enlisting the voice talents of a team of genre veterans to craft a new cult favorite.

title: Miami Connection
description: This crowd-pleasing explosion of bone-breaking insanity remains the most wildly enjoyable new wave ninja musical masterpiece of all time. Multi-national martial arts rock band Dragon Sound have had enough and embark on a roundhouse wreck-wave of crime-crushing justice and they won’t be stopped until they’ve completely destroyed the drug dealers, drunk bikers, kill-crazy ninjas, middle-aged thugs, the “stupid cocaine”… and the entire Miami Connection!!!

title: New York Ninja (New 35mm Print)
description: A city plagued by crime turns to a new kind of hero! A mild-mannered working man will become a sword wielding ninja vigilante after the brutal murder of his pregnant wife. And, yes, sometimes he even wears roller skates when ridding the streets of muggers, pickpockets, rapists, and kidnappers. title: Arrebato (New 35mm Print)
description: A dimension-shattering blend of heroin, sex, and Super-8, international cult film sensation Arrebato makes its long-awaited US debut, 40 years late but feeling as fresh as ever! Horror movie director José is adrift in a sea of doubt and drugs. As his belated second feature nears completion, his reclusive bubble is popped by two events: a sudden reappearance from an ex-girlfriend and a package from past acquaintance Pedro: a reel of Super-8 film, an audiotape, and a door key. From there, the boundaries of time, space, and sexuality are erased as José is once more sucked into Pedro’s vampiric orbit. Together, they attempt the ultimate hallucinogenic catharsis through a moebius strip of filming and being filmed. (Altered Innocence)

title: Videodrome
description: Kim Morgan discusses Videodrome on the New Beverly blog.

title: Arrebato (New 35mm Print)
description: A dimension-shattering blend of heroin, sex, and Super-8, international cult film sensation Arrebato makes its long-awaited US debut, 40 years late but feeling as fresh as ever! title: Videodrome
description: Kim Morgan discusses Videodrome on the New Beverly blog.

title: Trainspotting
description: Choose life. Choose a job. Choose a starter home. Choose dental insurance, leisure wear and matching luggage. Choose your future. But why would anyone want to do a thing like that? Director Danny Boyle’s electrifying look at the exhilarating highs and terrifying lows of the Edinburgh drug scene is daringly original, energetically stylish, and brutally funny, with a stellar ensemble including Ewan McGregor, Jonny Lee Miller, and Robert Carlyle, plus one of the most iconic soundtracks of the ‘90s.

title: Death Proof
description: “The climactic extended car chase is a bona fide old-school tour de force.” – Ben Walters, Time Out

title: Jailhouse Rock
description: Elvis Presley in his first big dramatic singing role! Sentenced to a stint in the slammer, a young inmate (the one-and-only Elvis) is mentored by his cellmate in the power of Jailhouse Rock. Fresh out of lockup, the singin’, guitar slingin’ virtuoso puts his new skills to good use and becomes a musical sensation. But will his sudden fame sideline all other aspects of his life, including his romantic new relationship with the music promoter (Judy Tyler) who helped make him a star?

title: Pink Floyd: The Wall
description: Pink Floyd’s lyricist & thematic leader Roger Waters teams with director Alan Parker and cartoonist Gerald Scarfe for an unsettling, unconventional film adaptation of the band’s bestselling concept album, combining music, striking visuals, biting politics, spaced-out symbolism, and surreal animation to tell the haunting tale of a troubled rock star’s descent into madness.

title: Jailhouse Rock
description: Elvis Presley in his first big dramatic singing role! Sentenced to a stint in the slammer, a young inmate (the one-and-only Elvis) is mentored by his cellmate in the power of Jailhouse Rock. Fresh out of lockup, the singin’, guitar slingin’ virtuoso puts his new skills to good use and becomes a musical sensation. But will his sudden fame sideline all other aspects of his life, including his romantic new relationship with the music promoter (Judy Tyler) who helped make him a star?

title: Trick or Treat
description: What are you afraid of? It’s only rock & roll. Devastated by the loss of his heavy metal hero, a troubled teenage superfan scores a copy of the satanic rocker’s as-yet-unreleased final album. But playing this record backwards could have diabolical consequences. American Graffiti star Charles Martin Smith’s directorial debut is a horrific Halloween hit that features excellent Kevin Yagher effects, cinematography by frequent Paul Thomas Anderson collaborator Robert Elswit, and a killer soundtrack by the band Fastway and composer Christopher Young.

title: Terror on Tour
description: A rock & roll slasher ultra-rarity directed by grindhouse legend Don Edmonds! Known for their Grand Guignol stage shows and their macabre, KISS-like makeup, The Clowns are a heavy band climbing the barbed ladder of success. But when people start turning up dead backstage, the police point their fingers at the group and their crew as their prime suspects.

title: Magnolia
description: “The more you think about Magnolia – the dry wit, the bravura staging, the intricate design, the wondrous performances – the better and more unusual the film seems.” – Michael Wilmington, Chicago Tribune

title: Magnolia
description: “The more you think about Magnolia – the dry wit, the bravura staging, the intricate design, the wondrous performances – the better and more unusual the film seems.” – Michael Wilmington, Chicago Tribune

title: Magnolia
description: “The more you think about Magnolia – the dry wit, the bravura staging, the intricate design, the wondrous performances – the better and more unusual the film seems.” – Michael Wilmington, Chicago Tribune

title: Above the Rim
description: Some games you play. Some games play you. Above the Rim is a stellar high school basketball melodrama with an electrifying cast, a vivid New York setting, and a sizzling Death Row-produced hip hop & soul soundtrack. The film follows a talented teenage hoops prospect (Duane Martin) and his relationships with two men on different paths, a charismatic drug dealer (an electrifying Tupac Shakur) and a troubled former b-ball star (Leon), in the lead-up to the city’s big streetball tournament. Featuring Bernie Mac, Marlon Wayans, and Wood Harris in memorable supporting roles, plus a Source Awards-winning Soundtrack of the Year with tracks by 2Pac, Tha Dogg Pound, the debut of Nate Dogg & Warren G’s Regulate, and more.

title: Sign ‘o’ the Times
description: “It’s Sign ‘O’ the Times that remains the star’s finest cinematic moment, a svelte jolt of everything that captures Prince at his most dazzling: the singing, the dancing, the multi-instrumental talent, the rapport with his band and those bolero-chic outfits.” – Elias Leight, Rolling Stone

title: Death Proof
description: “The climactic extended car chase is a bona fide old-school tour de force.” – Ben Walters, Time Out

title: Mary Poppins (IB Tech Print)
description: “I find it irresistible. Plenty of other adults will feel the same way. And, needless to say, so will the kids.” – Bosley Crowther, The New York Times

title: Sign ‘o’ the Times
description: “It’s Sign ‘O’ the Times that remains the star’s finest cinematic moment, a svelte jolt of everything that captures Prince at his most dazzling: the singing, the dancing, the multi-instrumental talent, the rapport with his band and those bolero-chic outfits.” – Elias Leight, Rolling Stone

title: Urgh! A Music War
description: A rarely screened concert film classic that’s power-packed with explosive performance footage of the most exciting & energetic early ‘80s punk rock & new wave acts! It’s live & loud, a nonstop bacchanal of bands, including iconic cuts from X, Devo, Joan Jett, The Go-Gos, The Cramps, The Police, Dead Kennedys, Oingo Boingo & MORE!

title: Mary Poppins (IB Tech Print)
description: “I find it irresistible. Plenty of other adults will feel the same way. And, needless to say, so will the kids.” – Bosley Crowther, The New York Times

title: Sign ‘o’ the Times
description: “It’s Sign ‘O’ the Times that remains the star’s finest cinematic moment, a svelte jolt of everything that captures Prince at his most dazzling: the singing, the dancing, the multi-instrumental talent, the rapport with his band and those bolero-chic outfits.” – Elias Leight, Rolling Stone

title: Equation to an Unknown (Adults Only)(New 35mm Print)
description: Explicit material meets melancholy arthouse sensibilities in a towering XXX masterpiece! A handsome young stud rides his motorcycle through a myriad of sexual situations, from a soccer game’s locker room to a dreamy and unsettling orgy. This rediscovered gem is a labyrinth of all-male fantasies whose outstanding beauties always end up fading away while leaving their sensual protagonist dealing with his own loneliness. Directed by the mysterious Dietrich de Velsa (aka Francis Savel / Frantz Salieri), a former painter who was also the owner and artistic director of one of the first transvestites’ cabarets of Paris, the legendary La Grande Eugène. Years later, he collaborated with Joseph Losey on Mr. Klein and Don Giovanni. Equation to an Unknown is his only film and it stands as the best French gay porn ever made.

title: Knife + Heart
description: “Equal parts kinky and kitsch, rendered with the kind of meticulous attention to lighting, composition, and sound that all but guarantees a cult following.” – Peter Debruge, Variety
